channel.title: How do I set a announcment every couple of minutes?
channel.description: Like how do I make a auto :yell thing saying 'Hello' every certain minutes?

item.title: How do I set a announcment every couple of minutes?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“parkview, post:7, topic:222394”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=292098.msg2352806#msg2352806 date=1217132245]

Add this int:

public int messagetimer = 0;

Then in your process(), add this

[code] if (messagetimer > 0) {
messagetimer += 1;
}

	if (messagetimer == 180) {
		messagetimer = 0;
                    PlayerHandler.messageToAll = ("MESSAGE GOES HERE");
	}[/code]

Replace the ‘MESSAGE GOES HERE’ with the announcment you wish for it to make.

Don’t use those retarded methods of timing. Use the preferred methods, e.g via the use of Timer, and TimerTask. Two classes in the java.util package.
[/quote]

Whats wrong with his method, does the job and simple and i like it :D[/quote]
The fact that it is stupid, slow, redundant?

Read full topic
item.source: How do I set a announcment every couple of minutes?

Add this int:

public int messagetimer = 0;

Then in your process(), add this

[code] if (messagetimer > 0) {
messagetimer += 1;
}

	if (messagetimer == 180) {
		messagetimer = 0;
                    PlayerHandler.messageToAll = ("MESSAGE GOES HERE");
	}[/code]

Replace the ‘MESSAGE GOES HERE’ with the announcment you wish for it to make.

[/quote]
Don’t use those retarded methods of timing. Use the preferred methods, e.g via the use of Timer, and TimerTask. Two classes in the java.util package.[/quote]

Whats wrong with his method, does the job and simple and i like it
